body.p: “I saw what I must have been either a muskrat’s or mink’s track “,” I think “,” since it came out of the water “,”—the tracks roundish and toes much rayed “,” four or five inches apart in the trail “,” with only a trifle more between the fore and hind legs “,” and the mark of the tail in successive curves as it struck the ice “,” thus: [image]”
PE 9, pg. 163 / 3 Sept 1854- 12 May 1855 / NNPM MA 1302:24 / T vol. # XVIII / PDF # XIII
